greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors of 2*n-1.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Dirichlet g.f. (with interpolated zeros): zeta(s)^2*(1-1/2^s)^2. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 15 2015
example: a(5)=3 because the divisors of 9 are: 1, 3 and 9.
mathematica: f[list_, i_] := list[[i]];a =Table[Boole[OddQ[n]], {n, 1, nn}];Select[Table[DirichletConvolve[f[a,n], f[a, n], n, m], {m, 1, nn}], # > 0 &] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 15 2015 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 19 2004
